content: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>  <reference anchor='I-D.zorn-emu-eap-pwc'> <front> <title>A Method for Changing Cleartext Passwords in the Extensible Authentication Protocol</title>  <author initials='G' surname='Zorn' fullname='Glen Zorn'>     <organization /> </author>  <date month='March' day='7' year='2011' />  <abstract><t>The Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) provides support for multiple authentication methods.  One such method is Generic Token Card (EAP-GTC) which, despite its name, is commonly used to support authentication using cleartext passwords in tunneled EAP methods. EAP-GTC does not provide the ability to change a password (for example, an expired password), however.  This document defines the PassWord Change EAP method (EAP-PWC) in order to fill that void in functionality.</t></abstract>  </front>  <seriesInfo name='Internet-Draft' value='draft-zorn-emu-eap-pwc-00' /> <format type='TXT'         target='http://www.ietf.org/internet-drafts/draft-zorn-emu-eap-pwc-00.txt' /> </reference>
